author: m.kalinin
content:
I has been recently working on decoupling Shanghai Engine API spec from Paris and noticed that `forkchoiceUpdatedV2` returns error if `payloadAttributes.withdrawals == null` and withdrawals are activated. At the same time `newPayloadV2` returns `INVALID` in the same situation. I personally don't like this inconsistency, and I also against abusing `INVALID` payload status. I am curious what EL clients return if `transactions == null`; do they return error or `INVALID` payload status?

My preference is to return error in all cases when payload is malformed. I remember <@543900561460822016> and <@755590043632140352> opinion on that is different. cc <@539495253418180618>

content: How does the user get blocks `PREVRANDAO` variable after merge https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4399#abstract, I would expect jsonrpc changed but there is nothing in spec: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/schemas/block.yaml

author: draganrakita
content: How did clients handle it, if it is not accessible it will break dev tools

author: m.kalinin
content: It should be returned in the “mixHash” field as the EIP says that this is the place where prevrandao lands on the execution layer chain. I feel like we should rename this field to “prevRandao” in JSON RPC schema
